RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the court: district court in Maria De Jesus Garcia's case

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country where the legal case is taking place, with a Constitution that protects residents from unreasonable searches and seizures
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Moore, Texas: location where the incident occurred, approximately 115 miles from the United States-Mexican border, and where border patrol agents had recently apprehended a number of illegal alien smugglers
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate Highway 35: highway where the incident took place, with northbound lanes, leading directly to the United States-Mexican border and passing through Laredo, Texas, known as a common smuggling route with a history of alien smuggling
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mexican border: geographical reference point, approximately 115 miles from Moore, Texas, relevant for roving border patrol stops
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexican border: geographical reference point relevant for roving border patrol stops and the Brignoni-Ponce test, approximately 115 miles south of the stop in Texas
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Laredo, Texas: location through which Interstate 35 passes, one of the towns before reaching Moore
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Brignoni-Ponce standard: a standard for reasonably warranting suspicion in border patrol stops
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.5th Circuit Court of Appeals: US Court of Appeals circuit reviewing the case regarding roving border patrol stops and the Brignoni-Ponce standard, providing instructions to jurors on their duties and responsibilities
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia's vehicle: vehicle searched for undocumented aliens and subject of a court case, described as a pickup truck with a camper shell attachment, traveling at 40-45 miles per hour late at night on Interstate 35
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.camper compartment of Maria De Jesus Gar: part of the vehicle where occupants were suspected to be hiding, with a dark cabin that was illuminated by a flashlight during the stop, and where physical movement occurred at night immediately after a bright flashlight was directed at the occupants, containing multiple people attempting to hide
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.jury in Maria De Jesus Garcia's trial: jury that received a modified Allen charge during deliberations, with their verdict being the subject of an appeal regarding potential coercion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.district court in Maria De Jesus Garcia': court that handled Maria De Jesus Garcia's trial, made decisions on post-verdict discovery requests, and provided instructions to the jury during deliberations
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas: location where Maria De Jesus Garcia was stopped, approximately 115 miles north of the United States-Mexican border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mexico: country of origin for illegal migrants
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S.-Mexico border: reference point for determining distance and relevant to the context of illegal alien traffic
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.back seat of Maria De Jesus Garcia's veh: location where passengers were observed slouching down
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.seat in Maria De Jesus Garcia's vehicle: general location where passenger behavior was observed
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate 35: a highway where Maria De Jesus Garcia's vehicle was traveling at an unusual slow speed late at night
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Cotulla, Texas: location of the border patrol station
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.area covered by the Cotulla, Texas stati: region served by border patrol agents Stanley Pruszenski and Alfred Baron
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.location of the instant stop: place where Maria De Jesus Garcia's vehicle was stopped by border patrol agents
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia's trial: trial where a modified Allen charge was given to the jury
